subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Are radio waves necessary?
author: SnowfireL@aol.com
full_text:
----------MB_8CCEE67DDC0D97A_1070_12258_webmail-d100.sysops.aol.com
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="utf-8"

 

 Since i live rural, i wonder if my property being next to a small priva=
te lake, and across the road about 1/4 mile is the tower for Altel now Veri=
son on the north west side, and same distance on the other side is ATT, the=
y are south east of me, then down further is another ATT tower, and plus my=
 big antennae on the roof, i wonder if that's help them come through on my =
FM RS 20-125 radio's, I don't even hear radio signal on them anymore, even =
on the FM channel, it's weird, and can't get any AM's either, AM's only giv=
e me this funny ringing noise, but the FM gives me static or them talking, =
I sure wish i could buy one of those fancy boxes Franks has bet I'd be a bo=
omin over here!=C2=A0 hint hint., sf



-----Original Message-----
From: Za=
ck Widup <w9sz.zack@...>
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Sat,=
 Jul 10, 2010 10:11 am
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Are radio waves necessary?

 =
         =C2=A0                                  
My take on it is that the=
 spirits or whatever they are=C2=A0are capable of using whatever methods ar=
e placed in front of them. DVR's get EVP. I've gotten EVP on the sound trac=
ks of a video recorder. The radio and ITC seems to generate a different cla=
ss of communication. EVP-Maker is another one.
  =C2=A0
 Probably the metho=
d of actually producing the sound waves=C2=A0is different for each device.
=
 =C2=A0
 Zack
 
=C2=A0
 On Sat, Jul 10, 2010 at 8:20 AM, John S <phenom_=
investigator@...> wrote:
  =C2=A0      
 Raymond Bayless was getti=
ng recorded spirit voices back in the 1950's.
 While his best known work wa=
s with von Salazy on audio tape, Bayless
 also received voices using an ear=
ly grammophone-style recording device.
 In other words, he was using strict=
ly a mechanical recorder. This would
 suggest that the voices may not requi=
re electronics at all. And that would
 imply that radio signals may have no=
thing to do with the voice reception.
 =C2=A0
 Consider too that EVPMAKER s=
essions seem to work well for some people.
 Except for the mechnical record=
ings, which are few in number, all the
 current techniques have electronics=
 in common. So it would make sense
 that electronics=C2=A0might be importan=
t to the process. However, when 
 you factor in the mechanical recordings m=
ade using devices prior to 
 modern electronics, it seems more sensible to =
look for a common 
 explanation which involves environmental manipulation. =
The most reasonable
 thing we know of that meets this criterion is mind-mat=
ter interaction,
 or psychokinesis (PK).
 =C2=A0
 The only remaining questi=
on then, aside from the actual source of the 
 information which cannot be =
objectively ascertained as of yet, is whether
 a single or multiple mechani=
sms are indeed at work. Even though radio waves 
 are not required to produ=
ce the phenomena, if multiple mechanisms are at work, 
 it may be=C2=A0that=
 radio waves are one of many ways the phenomena is produced.
 =C2=A0
 Botto=
m line, with so many options much more information is needed to form any
 r=
easonable hypothesis.
 =C2=A0
 =C2=A0
 =C2=A0
 =C2=A0


 


 





 
      =

<div> <font color=3D"navy">Since i live rural, i wonder if my propert=

 the tower for Altel now Verison on the north west side, and same distance =
on the other side is ATT, they are south east of me, then down further is a=
nother ATT tower, and plus my big antennae on the roof, i wonder if that's =
help them come through on my FM RS 20-125 radio's, I don't even hear radio =
signal on them anymore, even on the FM channel, it's weird, and can't get a=
ny AM's either, AM's only give me this funny ringing noise, but the FM give=
s me static or them talking, I sure wish i could buy one of those fancy box=
es Franks has bet I'd be a boomin over here!  hint hint., sf<br>
</fon=
t></div>

ems to generate a different class of communication. EVP-Maker is another on=

<div>Probably the method of actually produc=

<div>Raymond Bayless was getting recorded spirit voices back in the 1950's.=
</div>
 
<div>While his best known work was with von Salazy on audio tape, =
Bayless</div>
 
<div>also received voices using an early grammophone-<wbr>s=
tyle recording device.</div>
 
<div>In other words, he was using strictly a=
 mechanical recorder. This would</div>
 
<div>suggest that the voices may n=
ot require electronics at all. And that would</div>
 
<div>imply that radio=
 signals may have nothing to do with the voice reception.</div>
 
<div>&nbs=
p;</div>
 
<div>Consider too that EVPMAKER sessions seem to work well for s=
ome people.</div>
 
<div>Except for the mechnical recordings, which are few=
 in number, all the</div>
 
<div>current techniques have electronics in com=
mon. So it would make sense</div>
 
<div>that electronics might be imp=
ortant to the process. However, when </div>
 
<div>you factor in the mechan=
ical recordings made using devices prior to </div>
 
<div>modern electronic=
s, it seems more sensible to look for a common </div>
 
<div>explanation wh=
ich involves environmental manipulation. The most reasonable</div>
 
<div>t=
hing we know of that meets this criterion is mind-matter interaction,</div>=

 
<div>or psychokinesis (PK).</div>
 
<div> </div>
 
<div>The only re=
maining question then, aside from the actual source of the </div>
 
<div>in=
formation which cannot be objectively ascertained as of yet, is whether</di=
v>
 
<div>a single or multiple mechanisms are indeed at work. Even though r=
adio waves </div>
 
<div>are not required to produce the phenomena, if mult=
iple mechanisms are at work, </div>
 
<div>it may be that radio waves =
are one of many ways the phenomena is produced.</div>
 
<div> </div>
 =

<div>Bottom line, with so many options much more information is needed to =
form any</div>
 
<div>reasonable hypothesis.</div>
